alert.note: Alert for Champaign; De Witt; McLean; Piatt; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:52AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Woodford, northeastern Piatt, northeastern De Witt, McLean and northwestern Champaign Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 251 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Goodfield to near Farmer City. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Farmer City around 255 AM CDT. Mansfield around 305 AM CDT. Hudson around 310 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Normal, Mahomet, Fisher, Towanda and Lake Of The Woods. This includes the following highways... Interstate 39 between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 55 between mile markers 145 and 179. Interstate 57 between mile markers 240 and 250. Interstate 74 between mile markers 112 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central and east central Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Champaign; De Witt; McLean; Piatt; Woodford
